title: Top Aberdeen airport hotel opens after £25m investment
text:
Top Aberdeen airport hotel opens after £25m investment Top Aberdeen airport hotel opens after £25m investment Details Category: Scotland Created on Tuesday, 08 September 2015 09:15 Aberdeen’s latest luxury hotel, the Crowne Plaza at Aberdeen International Airport, has opened after 18 months of construction. Premium UK hospitality company Dominvs has invested £25 million in the 165-bedroom hotel which has created over 80 jobs for the local area. The 165-bedroom hotel, which features a conferencing and events centre and state of the art amenities, is the ideal destination for business and leisure guests. Its Offshore Bar & Grill is a destination in itself and provides locally sourced produce as well as an extensive drinks list offering a wide array of fine whiskies. 
Sean Brookes, Chief Operating Officer, Dominvs Hospitality. said: “I believe that bringing a hotel of this calibre to Aberdeen benefits both the business traveller and local community, offering luxury facilities at an affordable price.” Guestrooms have 40” flat screen TVs and built-in USB ports located on wall sockets. The colour palette features neutral tones combined with gold and granite accents, emphasising the overall luxurious and contemporary theme. Front-facing rooms feature panoramic views of the airport’s runway. The public areas boast fashionable furnishings with decorative elements inspired by Scottish heritage. Guests enjoy free high speed Wi-Fi, ample car parking, real-time flight departure and arrivals displays, a club lounge, Starbucks cafe and fully equipped gym. The conference and events centre includes 10 meeting and event rooms with seating capacity for up to 300. These are fitted out with the latest technology, including video and audio streaming, touch screen control panels and retractable projection screens. It has a separate entrance and bar. Crowne Plaza Aberdeen Airport is directly linked to the terminal through the hotel’s covered walkway. Andrew Mcloughlin, General Manager, Crowne Plaza Aberdeen Airport hotel, added: “The team and I have worked hard together over the past few months to turn this hotel into a true destination. We are excited to welcome our first guests into the hotel and are confident they will love it as much as we do” Preetpal Ahluwalia, Director, Dominvs Hospitality went on: “The Crowne Plaza Aberdeen Airport was a massive project and one that took a lot of perseverance and commitment. “When you first enter, you can see how much hard work went into its construction, from the overall impression it leaves to the smallest detail. I am extremely grateful to everyone who made the project their priority over the past 18 months. The hotel itself has so much personality that I am certain it will be a Must Visit destination in Aberdeen” Related articles
